lead_paragraph: For 70 years, New Jersey has banned self-serve gas stations and most residents want it to stay that way.

headline.print_headline: Drop That Nozzle: New Jersey Remains a Full-Service Island
headline.main: Drop That Gas Nozzle: New Jersey Is Full-Service Island, and Likes It

snippet: For 70 years, New Jersey has banned self-serve gas stations and most residents want it to stay that way.
abstract: Democratic leaders in New Jersey State Senate and Assembly avow legislation to end state's ban on self-service gas stations will never be brought to a vote; Gov Chris Christie refuses to comment on proposal, put forth by Republicans, despite proposing similar idea in 2009; proponents of bill question opposition to self-service gas pumps but polls show majority of New Jerseyans do not want to give up full service.
